Description: Issue stems from lack of proper introduction to the platform.
When to Choose: Use when the user is missing training, has an incomplete implementation, or hasn't had a walkthrough of key workflows.

Description: The UI/UX or workflow is confusing despite being technically functional.
When to Choose: Use when a reasonable user would struggle to discover or use a feature without direct guidance.

Description: Help content is missing, outdated, or hard to understand.
When to Choose: Use when confusion or misuse is directly caused by contradictions or gaps in the help center/guides.

Description: Requested capability is not currently possible and requires a new feature.
When to Choose: Use for net-new feature requests that cannot be solved by a bug fix or configuration change.

Description: The user did not invest the necessary time to follow instructions.
When to Choose: Use when the product and docs are adequate, but the user skipped steps or abandoned the flow early.

Description: The customer made a clear mistake despite having all necessary tools.
When to Choose: Use for incorrect formulas, misconfigured permissions, or choosing the wrong data source.

Description: The problem was temporary and not reliably reproducible.
When to Choose: Use for one-off glitches, momentary service degradation, or brief network problems.

Description: User needs best-practice advice rather than troubleshooting.
When to Choose: Use when the user asks for modeling strategy, dashboard design, or performance tuning advice.

Description: Issue is caused by a system outside of the platform's codebase.
When to Choose: Use for upstream data system failures, browser issues, or third-party service outages.

Description: Confirmed or suspected defect in the product or infrastructure.
When to Choose: Use for regressions, crashes, or data inconsistencies where the product deviates from the spec.

Description: A recent deployment directly introduced the issue.
When to Choose: Use when a breaking change or regression occurs immediately following a specific software release.

Description: Situation does not fit other categories or is for training.
When to Choose: Use for test tickets, internal exercises, or unique edge cases without a defined root cause.
